api_contracts.description: Returns a simple Hello World message

component_logic.responsibility: Initialize and configure the FastAPI application server

interfaces.description: Create and configure FastAPI application instance
Add basic middleware for CORS and error handling

component_logic.implementation_notes: Use FastAPI() constructor with title='Hello World API' and version='1.0.0'. Add CORSMiddleware to allow all origins for development. Configure exception handlers for 500 errors to return JSON format. Set up basic logging configuration.

component_logic.responsibility: Handle GET /hello requests and return Hello World response

interfaces.description: Return Hello World message as JSON response

component_logic.implementation_notes: Use FastAPI @app.get('/hello') decorator. Return dictionary with single key 'message' and value 'Hello World'. Response will be automatically serialized to JSON by FastAPI. No input validation needed as endpoint takes no parameters.

component_logic.responsibility: Handle HTTP errors and exceptions with proper status codes and JSON responses

interfaces.description: Handle 500 internal server errors with JSON response
Register exception handlers with FastAPI app

component_logic.implementation_notes: Use @app.exception_handler(500) decorator for internal server errors. Return JSONResponse with status_code=500 and JSON body containing error code and message. Log exceptions using Python logging module. Handle generic Exception class to catch any unhandled errors.

design_review_checklist.description: Verify FastAPI application is properly structured with separation of concerns
design_review_checklist.validation_criteria: FastAPIServer handles app initialization, HelloWorldHandler handles route logic, ErrorHandler manages error responses. No business logic mixed with server setup.

design_review_checklist.description: Verify proper HTTP status codes and JSON error responses
design_review_checklist.validation_criteria: ErrorHandler must return JSONResponse with proper status codes. 500 errors must return JSON format, not HTML. Exception handler must be registered with FastAPI app.

design_review_checklist.description: Verify endpoint returns response efficiently without unnecessary processing
design_review_checklist.validation_criteria: HelloWorldHandler.get_hello() must return static dictionary directly. No database calls, file I/O, or complex computations for simple Hello World response.

design_review_checklist.description: Verify response format matches API contract exactly
design_review_checklist.validation_criteria: Response must be JSON object with single 'message' key containing exactly 'Hello World' string. No additional fields or different message text.

design_review_checklist.description: Verify proper FastAPI decorators and routing configuration
design_review_checklist.validation_criteria: Route must use @app.get('/hello') decorator. Method must be async def or regular def. FastAPI app must be properly instantiated and configured.

design_review_checklist.description: Verify logging is configured for error tracking
design_review_checklist.validation_criteria: ErrorHandler must log exceptions using Python logging module. Log level should be ERROR or higher. Include exception details in log messages.

architecture_overview: Simple single-tier FastAPI web application with three components: FastAPIServer initializes the web framework, HelloWorldHandler implements the /hello endpoint logic, and ErrorHandler manages HTTP error responses. No database or external dependencies required. Follows FastAPI best practices with proper separation of server setup, route handling, and error management.
assumptions: Application runs on single process/thread (no concurrency requirements)
No authentication or authorization needed for /hello endpoint
CORS is enabled for all origins (development setup)
Server runs on default host and port (uvicorn defaults)
No rate limiting required for simple Hello World endpoint
Error responses follow JSON format for API consistency
